Resist Officer - Substantial Bodily Harm/Soft Tissue Injury

result.execSummary:
The defendant Larry Joe Hines Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Signed and Filed:  Decision Commuting Probation and Order Amending Judgment of Conviction. 
Copy sent to DOC.  Case forwarded to Clerk's Office for processing.
Filed:  Proposed Decision Commuting Probation and Order Amending Judgment of Conviction.
Letters from DCC Records staff to Court regarding sentence structure
Received and Filed:  Defendant's Character Letter

Defendant Larry Joe Hines Jr in court.  Attorney Michael K. Moran in court for Larry Joe Hines Jr.  Attorney Grace M. Gall in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for plea/sentencing.  Parties have reached an agreement.  Plea negotiations set forth on the record and agreed upon by the parties.  Amended Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Plea hearing proceeded.  

AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 2:
Defendant changes pleas to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's pleas.  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Pursuant to plea negotiations and on the motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT 3 DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.  

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon, he may never own or possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by the State, Defense Counsel, and Defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to 12 MONTHS in the House of Correction, CONCURRENT to Count 2 but CONSECUTIVE to the sentence in case #20CF4578, with credit for 6 days time served. The Court granted Huber privileges for work, school, and child care.  

AS TO COUNT 2: 
The Court sentenced the defendant to 4 MONTHS in the House of Correction, CONCURRENT to Count 1 but CONSECUTIVE to the sentence in case #20CF4578.  The Court granted Huber privileges for work, school, and child care.  

AS TO BOTH COUNTS
The Court STAYED these sentences and placed the defendant on probation for 2 YEARS. 

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION: 
- Full-time work/school (minimum of 40 hours of work per week). 
- Obtain a valid driver's license. 
- Work on obtaining a HS diploma/GED/HSED. 
- Provide DNA sample. 

Court ordered the defendant to pay all court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA) by the end of supervision.  Cash bond on deposit is to be applied.  Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment. 

20 day appeal rights given.
